title: Documentary: John Pilger collection DVD 1 **RESEED**
description:
Reseed due to hardware failure.


The first of four DVD&#039;s in from the "Documentaries that changed the world" collection.


I do not have unlimited upload speed, so you need to be a bit patient. However, I will keep seeding day and night until there are enough seeders.


On this DVD ISO:

1. Year Zero: The Silent Death of Cambodia (1979)
The shocking state of Cambodia after Pol Pot&#039;s murderous regime.

2. Nicaragua: A Nation&#039;s Right to Survive (1983)
With 4,000 hostile troops strung along Nicaragua&#039;s jungle borders with Honduras, John Pilger investigates this tiny nation&#039;s right to survive.

3. Burp! Pepsi v Coke in The Ice Cold War (1984)
This is the first film made by John Pilger with director Alan Lowery, a fellow Australian. It looks at the worldwide struggle for soft drink supremacy by the Coca Cola company, which illuminates the power of multinational cooporations.

4. Flying the Flag, Arming the World (1994)
John Pilger and David Munro look behind the political rhetoric and discover the world of international arms dealing. Won a Bronze Apple in the category of &#039;Domestic and International Concerns&#039;, National Educational Film & Video Festival, Oakland, California, 1995; Certificate of Honourable Mention in the &#039;International Relations&#039; category, The Chris Awards (Columbus International Film Festival), Worthington, Ohio, 1995.
